page.title: 09FELMINGHAM VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The{Village Hall}was built in 1974, replacing an old war-time Nissen Hut, on land owned by the village at a cost of Â£12,000. Of this Â£8,000 was grants from the Council. The adjoining playing field is land leased from the Church Commissioners. The Hall is the hub of Village life, and money for its upkeep is raised by an{Annual Fete,Flower & Vegetable Show held on the first Saturday in August. All the clubs using the Hall take part. Dances, Social Evenings and Concerts are regularly held, and September l985 sees the process of installing a licensed bar well under way, to further improve the social life in the Village. Most of the{Village Clubs}hold their meetings in the Hall.
